ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Hmmm.  Someone else looking at DAoC?
ygData.msgSnippet: I dont find the learning curve any worse than in EQ. The fact that you cant minimize cant scare me. You couldent do that with EQ either.. Well you can, but it
ygData.messageBody:
I dont find the learning curve any worse than in EQ.
The fact that you cant minimize cant scare me. You couldent do that with EQ
either.. Well you can, but it requires a 3rd party program..
Besides when Im playing a game I dont need ot alt tab back and forth to
other things. And I do agree with Mythic that disabling alt-tab is an easy
and good way to avoid script kiddies hacking the game... EQ limited hacking
greatly by what it has done. Just compare it with UO.

Musiker


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
> Sent: 10. oktober 2001 16:39
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hmmm. Someone else looking at DAoC?
>
>
> At 04:23 PM 10/10/2001 +0200, you wrote:
> >Tip: Select RPG setting at the options screen and key
> mapping is very close
> >to how EQ works. And yes you can remap them too.
> >I hate that you cant do it while youre playing though :( Ohh
> well that is a
> >minor issue
>
>
> Actually - that was almost what stopped me from playing
> entirely the first
> time I fired it up - that and the initial learning curve.
> Now it's an "I
> can't minimize the window" issue, though. I have to be using
> my computer
> for other functions, even while playing, so I can't have
> anything running
> that I can't minimize.
>
> Talies the Wanderer
